text: hi everyone
here the internet's busiest music nerd
and it's time for a review of this new
lizzo album special this is a brand new
LP from singer songwriter flautist lizzo
she's back finally following up her
fantastic breakout record because I love
you from 2019. that record represented
an era that showed lizzo dropping a lot
of Snappy and Sassy Bops that fused rap
and pop and R B and soul resulting in
some of the most viral hits of the past
few years be it boys or truth hurts
juice since the pandemic she's been
keeping a bit of a low profile musically
outside of maybe a collaboration or a
crossover here and there and she
eventually gave us our first taste of
this new record through the song about
damn time a light disco throwback with
very funky guitars and bass and keys
lyrically it's pretty much an assuring
pop Anthem that sounds like it is in a
better place after having recently moved
through a rough patch as far as modern
pop generally goes I think the track
instrumentally comes across a bit Bland
but it's not anything that can't be made
up for wasn't made up for by a lizzo's
vocal talents which I think she is one
of the stronger singers in the
mainstream currently and also just like
a really fantastic hook on the cut too
but even after having heard and enjoyed
this track I'm not really sure what I
expected from special when it eventually
dropped especially since lizzo's
execution and personality and formula
seem to be fully formed on her last
full-length album which really really
worked for her so you know why fix
what's not broken like obviously lizzo
knows her way around of course she has a
lot of Versatility to her sound and
style already what more could she
possibly add plus her trademark sense of
humor on a lot of her Cuts is really
just like an added bonus like in so many
ways she is the total package but For
Better or For Worse special does have a
different approach than that of any
lizzo album prior and the results are
kind of a mixed bag and yes of course
there are highlights on this thing but
there are just as many moments like the
song I love you [ __ ] which kind of
comes across instrumentally like a very
run-of-the-mill synth pop cut that feels
less specific to lizzo and More in line
with this you know new found to 80s
Trend that's in a lot of mainstream
Music These Days meanwhile the song
girls features a Beastie Boys
interpolation of the song girls which
comes across like an ill-conceived
experiment of some sort plus I think
lizzo is trying a little too hard to
come across unhinged on this track
especially with this weird ass male
genital mutilation bar and that's not
even the only moment on this record that
comes across thirsty for attention like
the track everybody's gay which in and
of itself when you dive into the lyrics
doesn't contain you know a bad sentiment
or anything like that it's a track that
describes getting dressed in an outfit
that you really like being yourself
welcoming and loving yourself the
application of the word gay on the track
seems to be more in line definitionally
with it uh being a synonym for happy but
then also the vaguely validating lyrics
on the track here and there uh do make
it seem like you could easily interpret
the usage of that word in the other way
long story short what I'm essentially
trying to say here is that it seems like
you know the the title kind of exists to
be sort of a and switch of some sort
obviously listeners are going to get
curious about a song title that
everybody's gay and if this song is
meant to be some kind of like you know
Pro lgbtq statement I think it could
have come across a lot stronger and it's
it's messaging because without that this
song pretty much just sounds like a very
watered-down Michael Jackson ripoff
which is kind of disappointing because
on all of her previous records on tracks
lizzo would always lead with her wit her
incredibly bold personality but there
are at least a handful of cuts on this
LP where that is uh pretty much missing
or it's been replaced by this very
general motivational poster style
positivity which isn't a bad thing in
small doses I mean Lord knows that my
spirits could certainly use some lifting
but are tracks like special for example
in my opinion as satisfying as something
like you know an eccentric Banger such
as Tempo from the last LP not really as
yeah tracks like that as well as I love
you [ __ ] just come across a bit too
pandering and even when lizzo is trying
to be more tongue-in-cheek like on the a
very playful birthday girl on this track
we kind of get the brand of humor you
would receive from I don't know a really
corny Comedy Channel on YouTube Circa
2012. either that or in instances such
as the opener it kind of seems like the
negativity and hatred that is very
unnecessarily thrown lizzo's way mind
you everybody who's kind of like you
know jumping down her throat over her
doing too much and so on and so forth
obviously those people can [ __ ] off and
shut the hell up but still the opening
track does make it feel like you know
these comments are getting to her a
little bit more than they should
honestly my favorite tracks from this LP
are the ones that seem to reflect on a
love that lizzo has been kind of working
through over the past few years whether
she is singing about you know her
personal journey of growing and learning
to accept that she can and she should be
loved on the song to be loved there's
also the song break up twice where she
is giving a love that fell apart another
chance which is complete with these all
two real descriptions of her friends
being mad at the guy showing up again
because at one point lizzo obviously
told them everything he had done I also
love the classic soul Melodies chords
and instrumentation on this track too I
mean hearing lizzo over something like
this as opposed to like an 80 style cut
you know just kind of like sees her in
her wheelhouse sees her inner element
and you can tell vocally just like how
well it kind of plays to her style to
her Timbre to her abilities the song if
you love me is a track that's very much
about the world and other people loving
you fully and completely as uh people
loving maybe just one or two things
about he was not really love some of the
lyrics on this track touched down on
themes of self-love in a really powerful
way too and I'd also like to highlight
that this is one of the few
inspirational tracks on this LP that I
actually like get a lot out of because I
think for Elizabeth comes from a much
more intimate and personal place than
some of the commentary publicly that may
be made on her at any given time there
are similar themes of being loved and
accepted on the track naked which is a
really powerful moment too just
instrumentally speaking as the horn
sections the heavy beats and the soaring
vocal harmonies on this track are are
insane and then there's the closer which
I think puts sort of a bow on this
ongoing love story that we're hearing in
glimpses on this LP where lizzo is
essentially saying that through all the
doubt and insecurities and changes she
is really like going all in on this
romantic interest and of course once
again the laid back beat the super warm
vintage bass line and the vocal work
sees lizzo throwing it back to like the
70s era but with a modern punch on the
production side what's kind of odd about
the track though is that it doesn't
exactly send the record off with a bang
and obviously the title kind of centers
the song around Coldplay there's a cold
play sample at the very beginning of the
song and in the lyrics it's pretty much
revealed that when lizzo is in her
feelings a little bit uh she she likes
to to put on some Coldplay but yeah
overall I thought this was a pretty
solid LP I mean not nearly as satisfying
as because I love you not nearly as many
constant Bops from front to back but in
a sense I I do appreciate the more of a
thematic focus on love and self-love and
so on and so forth on this LP that's
quite nice even if I think that
messaging isn't always nailed on some of
these tracks but yeah I've seen a reason
why the fan shouldn't be digging this
one if you dug because I love you at
least a little bit lizzo still sounds
like lizzo she seems like she's worked
through a lot personally and got to a
much better place at least a good enough
of a place to make this record and
hopefully on a future LP we see her in
even better standing artistically I'm
feeling a strong six to a light seven on
this one transition have you given this
